text: Even photographs taken at the time don’t capture how glorious my hair used to be. Only poets singing each to each, borrowing from the memories of eyewitnesses, can capture anything of its crimson majesty.
author: tcarmody

text:
The new routine is something like this:

STYLIST: You have such nice hair.
ME: Thank you.
STYLIST: And such a pretty color.
ME: It used to be redder.
STYLIST: Like your beard?
ME: Like a can of Coke.
author: tcarmody

text: I don’t especially like getting my hair cut but when it goes well, part of me wishes I could get my hair cut every day

text: Even if that something is “parents who pay your bills,” there are worse bets to make. Sure, you’re closing yourself to talent from the rest of the country, but those people are probably weirdos who wouldn’t understand your lives or something

text: At a certain point, posting jobs that could be done from anywhere but restricting them to a handful of coastal cities has to serve SOME function, even if it’s unnamed, of social proof: you survived working in those cities, ergo you must have something going for you

text:
Some days you feel like a cartoon
And people will rush to make excuses for you
You'll hear yourself complain
But don't you ever shut up please
Kid, have your say
'Cause I still love you
Even if I don't see you again

text: This week’s Noticing newsletter just went out. text:
The thing about coaches who yell is that nine times out of ten, they are the biggest candy asses when you yell back at them. 

It’s like, my dad (and mom) yelled a lot louder than you can. Is this how it’s gonna be? Then let’s do it.
author: tcarmody

text: Izzo’s freakouts/tantrums feel like they’ve gotten worse this year. It’s not a good trend line.
author: tcarmody

text: I am a big Tom Izzo fan, but I don’t like the way he aggressively screams at players. I don’t think it’s admirable or even helpful. I hated when I was coached that way and can’t imagine his players appreciating it any more than I did. Bobby Knight is not a role model.
